content: शांत {%<ab>p. p.</ab>%} [शम्-क्त] {@--1@} Appeased, allayed, calmed, satisfied, pacified; <ls>R. 12</ls>, <ls n="R.">20.</ls> {@--2@} Cured, alleviated; शांतरोगः. {@--3@} Abated, subsided, put an end to, removed, extinguished; शांतरथक्षोभपरिश्रमं <ls>R. 1. 58</ls>; <ls n="R.">5. 47</ls>; शांतार्चिषं दीपमिव प्रकाशः <ls>Ki. 17. 16.</ls> {@--4@} Ceased, stopped; शांतमृगप्रचारं <ls>Ku. 3. 42.</ls> {@--5@} Dead, deceased. {@--6@} Stilled, hushed. {@--7@} Calm, quiet, undisturbed, tranquil, still; शांतमिदमाश्रमपदं <ls>Ś. 1. 16</ls>; <ls n="Ś.">4. 19.</ls> {@--8@} Tamed; <ls>R. 14. 79.</ls> {@--9@} Free from passions, at ease, contented. {@--10@} Shaded. {@--11@} Gentle; शांतानुकूलपवनश्च शिवश्च पंथाः <ls>Ś. 4. 10.</ls> {@--12@} Purified. {@--13@} Meek, humble. {@--14@} Auspicious (in augury); (the phrase शांतं पापं, which is sometimes repeated, means ‘oh, no!’ 'how can it be’, ‘God forbid such an untoward or unlucky event’; <ls>Ś. 5</ls>; <ls>Mu. 1</ls>). --तः {@--1@} A man who has subdued his passions, an ascetic. {@--2@} Tranquillity, quietism, the sentiment of quietism, the predominant feeling of which is indifference to worldly objects and pleasures; see निर्वेद and रस. --तं Appeasing, pacifying. --तं {%<ab>ind.</ab>%} Enough, no more, not so, for shame, hush!, god (heaven) forbid!; शांतं कथं दुर्जनाः पौरजानपदाः <ls>U. 1</ls>; तामेव शांतमथवा किमिहोत्तरेण <ls n="U.">3. 26.</ls>
